data.title: Air resistance for RigidBody
data.body: It would be very nice if the RigidBody has built-in air resistance (Drag and Angular Drag properties), similar to [Unity](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-Rigidbody.html).

data.title: IntArray, FloatArray, etcArray crash a game when accessing out of bounds index with get() (Should be detected by debugger)
data.body:
Accessing to IntArray, FloatArray, StringArray, Vector2Array,  Vector3Array, ColorArray with incorrect index is not detected by Godots debugger
For example this code will hard crash the game:

```
    var vector = Vector2Array()
    vector.get(0)
```

data.title: PI is not a constant
data.body:
const max_angle = PI/2
gives an error, complaining that the expression is not a constant.

data.title: Ability to make animations unique without changing names
data.body: As of now, a duplicate AnimationPlayer will share the animation and the parameters with the original. Sometimes it would be convenient to use relative transform paths in an animation and just duplicate the AnimationPlayer, tweak the parameters on its version of the animation, then reparent it to a different node. This would make it so that you can use a template for the animation and then play the same animation name on each node through GDScript, resulting in a different behavior in each case.

data.title: Fix typo that produced invalid markup for images
Encrypting scripts leads to Godot not being able to load game assets
data.body:
I'm in the process of releasing my game. When I supply 256bit hex key for encrypting the scripts, the game won't get past the splash screen.

In the debug console it is apparent that the *.gd assets can not be loaded.

Should this be working?

data.title: Crash when queue_free called on windows.
data.body:
```
func _on_start_pressed():
  Globals.main.loading_scene.start()
  yield(NewTimer.wait(0.8), "timeout")
  var loader = Globals.main.load_level("level_test.scn")
  yield(loader, "complete")
  Globals.main.loading_scene.over()
  queue_free()  #work fine when  delete this line.
```

This script works fine on linux or OSX, crash on windows.

data.title: Changes in RigidBody Rotation and Scale properties aren't reflected in the game
data.body:
I have a RigidBody, and it has two children: a CollisionShape (BoxShape) and a TestCube.
When I select the RigitBody and change it's Rotation and Scale properties, it is immediately reflected corectly in the editor. But when I run the game, it appears like Rotation and Scale are in their default values: (0,0,0) and (1,1,1).

data.title: Changing default value of exported variable not reflected in editor
data.body: When I change the default value of an export var in the GDScript, it is not reflected in the editor, or to the engine. Only after I temporarily re-name the variable, it gets updated.

data.title: Allow different coefficients for static and kinetic friction
data.body:
How do I stop objects from sliding? They just slide all the way down they can, even when the friction is set to 1 for both of them.

It seems "friction" property in godot only controls kinetic friction. Please consider adding [static friction](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-PhysicMaterial.html) to the physics engine!

data.title: keyboard hide show in mobile
data.body:
I was reading the code for android and I saw functions for hide and show keybaord but it was not binded to gdscript I wonder why ? 
I think status of keyboard is it showing or not , and function to hide and show it can be very helpful. why not just bind them to gdscript?

data.title: Querying inertia tensor from GDScript
data.body: Is there a (or will there be a) way of querying the inertia tensor of a body? (something along the lines of [this](http://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Rigidbody-inertiaTensor.html) maybe)

data.title: [Feature request] Exposing script variables in the GUI
data.body:
In one of the games I'm working on, I've decided to make the enemies configurable. This is easily done via GDScript, but it's very cumbersome when there are dozens or hundreds of them in the scene and each one of them has to be initialized by adding a line to the scene script. It also makes keeping track of the changes borderline impossible. 
What would be best is if there was an ability to expose the configuration variables in the GUI, so that one could see the effects while designing the level.

data.title: Splashscreen does not scale to fullscreen on Linux
data.body:
On Linux, the splash screen always shows in size of the viewport, even when the game is started in fullscreen. The rest of the screen is black or filled with GPU artifacts.

On windows it works, is scaled to fullscreen.

data.title: Loading GDScripts Not Working
scene of a sub-viewport is drawn outside the sub-viewport
data.body: The instanced scene of a sub-viewport is drawn outside the sub-viewport, i.e. the scene is drawn relative to the root viewport and not the sub-viewport. See http://code.guido-berhoerster.org/tmp/BugReproducer2.tar.gz for a minimal project to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Camera 3D node makes godot to crash
data.body: If i create a project then add a spatial node then a camera godot will close, the i download the examples from the web and when i open the scene and touch the camera node in hierarchy godot crash, all this is happening with godot 1.1 stable version

data.title: CollisionShape2D editor
data.body:
A simple visual editor for the CollisionShape2D node, available for the following shapes:
- CapsuleShape2D
- CircleShape2D
- RayShape2D
- RectangleShape2D
- SegmentShape2D

data.title: Make path/polygon editing more user friendly
data.body: While path and polygon editing is crucial in some cases, it is very important to user, to see it behaving as he want it to. While Adobe Illustrator seems to be a technology standard in that topic nowadays, I would love to see godot working more like it when it comes to vector graphics.

data.title: Problem when drawing CollisionPolygon when parented
data.body:
When drawing CollisionPolygon ( spacial one ) that has a parent ( with non 0 local transfomation ), the polygon itself is drawn it the other place then the mouse position is. Some coordinates are transformed wrong over there. It is possible to close the polygon by clicking on the first point - while it is rendered wrong.

![polygon3d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615905/8228352/5fa5ab7c-15ae-11e5-8e31-2701a7a76b7a.jpg)

data.title: No way to close Path / Path2D manually
data.body: There is no way to close Path and Path2D manually while editing by clicking on it's first point - while it is possible while editing polygons ie. It's only possible by clicking the "close path" button which is quite unusable.

data.title: Wrong rendering after changing parent of Path2D/Polygon2D etc
data.body:
After changing parent of every object like Path2D, Polygon2D etc. the editing curve is rendered wrong, while it's texture and the proper curve are rendered correctly.

This is how it looks like for polygon2d
![polygon2d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615905/8228030/fee204ea-15ab-11e5-912c-e431337f8e88.png)

and for path2d
![path2d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615905/8228036/069a6a10-15ac-11e5-8b4d-7d6993c84b9e.png)

It's very similar to colliding ones. It updates ie. after moving it - but you don't always want to.

data.title: Cant add second anchor point to first cotrol point in Path2D
data.body: There is no option to add second anchor point in the first point of Path2D - while it is possible to do it on Path3D. Also editing both is quite different and incoherent to me - including shortcuts for doing same things.

data.title: Godot crash on replacing Path2D node
data.body:
1. Create Path2D node.
2. Select it.
3. Hit "Replace a Node by Another Node Type"
4. Crash.

Not crashing on Path3D.

data.title: Middle mouse button now searches the help for the text over the mouse
data.body: Kinda hacked this feature into TextEdit, but it executes only when tools are enabled. It's a really helpful feature when scripting and you need to check something really quick. Recommend implementing with #2111.

data.title: Fixed help search showing after displaying result
data.body: The default behavior for Shift+F1 from the code editor to the editor help is to open the corresponding page or open the search if it can't find. In the former case, not releasing Shift+F1 fast enough will open the search in the editor help, getting in the way of what you were searching for. This fix makes it so editor help only responds to the key press.

data.title: [Windows] Created window is centered by default
data.body:
Looks much nicer when the window is created at the center of the screen as opposed to the top-left

Note: Windows only

data.title: Create engine.cfg from command line
data.body:
I need to add an option to create empty project in current directory (or one specified by path)
to use in scripts. 
Use case: I create deploy project for showcase and want to keep my current development to myself, I run script wich creates empty project and copies stuff from development project, then runs godot binary with -e without using launcher which is not very useful with large number of template projects.
Then I can quickly edit new project and export it. This doesn't clutter launcher window with many
crappy one-time-usage projects.

This usage scenario is not possible without this feature.

data.title: Arrays can't be modified on the global scope when used as function arguments
data.body:
I try pass a array elements to a constructor like it

```
class GPointer:
    var cross
    var outline

    func _init(elements,t1,t2):
        cross = GRect.new(t1)
        outline = GRect.new(t2)
        elements.push_back(cross)
        elements.push_back(outline)

func _ready():
    var p = GPointer.new(elements,mira1,mira1_out)
    p.translate( Vector2(100,100) )
    pointers.push_back( p )
    update()

    set_process(true)
```

The result is blank array!!!!

The solution is work outside of class:

```
class GPointer:
    var cross
    var outline

    func _init(elements,t1,t2):
        cross = GRect.new(t1)
        outline = GRect.new(t2)
        elements.push_back(cross)
        #elements.push_back(outline)

func _ready():
    var p = GPointer.new(elements,mira1,mira1_out)
    p.translate( Vector2(100,100) )
    elements.push_back( p.cross )
    elements.push_back( p.outline )
    pointers.push_back( p )
    update()

    set_process(true)
```

This is no a first time that I have troubles with arrays in initializations https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2015

data.title: One-click deploy on Android fails if "Clear previous install" is unchecked
data.body:
When using one-click deploy to install a game to an Android device, the installation fails with INSTALL_FAILED_ALREADY_EXISTS if the "Clear previous install" option is unchecked and the .apk is already installed.

If the .apk is already installed, the `adb install` command needs the `-r` flag (replace existing application) to properly install the updated version.

The fix should be trivial: simply adding `args.push_back("-r");` at line 1538 of platform/android/export/export.cpp should solve the issue:

``` C++
args.push_back("install");
args.push_back("-r");   // <- Add this
args.push_back(export_to);
```
